Phrase  A "phrase" is a small group of words that adds meaning to a sentence.
A phrase is not a sentence because it is not a complete idea with a subject, verb and a predicate.

Preposition  Prepositions are words which link nouns, pronouns and phrases to other words in a sentence  Prepositions usually describe the position of something, the time when something happens and the way in which something is done, although the prepositions "of", "to" and "for" have some separate functions.
For example, in the sentence: "The dog that was walking down the street", the relative pronoun is the word that referring back to the antecedent, the word 'dog'.

In the sentence, "cool the hot dish", the word 'cool' is a verb.
In the sentence, "it is a cool evening", the word 'cool' is an adjective.
As a rule, the same word can play different roles but not in the same sentence.
